learning_objective: Organize and present collected data visually to highlight relationships and support a claim.
question_str:
{
    "Question": "Sasha is a sociologist who wants to assess people’s relationships with their peers through a program. They write code in Quorum to determine the number of positive interactions a person has with their peers. The code observes the interactions of a person with a list of classmates. When there is a positive interaction, the 'positiveInteraction' count increases by 1. What will the output be after interacting with 5 classmates having all positive interactions?",
    "Answer1": "The output will be 1.",
    "Answer2": "The output will be 5.",
    "Answer3": "The output will depend on the number of negative interactions.",
    "Answer4": "The output will be 0.",
    "CorrectAnswer": "2",
    "Explanation": "The code increments the 'positiveInteraction' count for every positive interaction, so after five positive interactions, the output will be 5.",
    "code_snippet": "integer positiveInteraction = 0\nrepeat 5 times\n    text interaction = GetNextInteraction()\n    if interaction == \"Positive\"\n        positiveInteraction = positiveInteraction + 1\n    end\nend\noutput \"Number of positive interactions: \" + positiveInteraction"
}
